Tears tonight. Remembering holding the hands of precious elders, keeping them company in their dying time. Thank you for expressing care, anger & rage at #letitrip. We are being robbed of treasures of immeasurable value. The grief shows that we care and we are paying attention.

To care for our elders is to care for our ancestorsâ€™ babies when the ancestors have crossed over. Honouring elders by caring for them adds joy, meaning, connection & richness to life. These busy politicians have probably run too hard all their lives to know. And it shows.

When a politician tells us that their policy decisions are breaking elders, I want them to break down. I want sobbing. I want sensitivity. Regret. I think I watch the media conferences looking for signs of humanity. But they talk like they broke something that was already broken.

Our elders are sacred. All of them. Some of them teach us about the beauty of gentleness, tenderness & touch when language & memory has faded. Others because they hold wisdom that comes from years of paying attention. Theyâ€™re our ancestors: the people that held us as babies.
